intro: Zosima pimpinelloides, commonly known as the mountain sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and small, heart-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated margin. Its flowers are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences and are typically greenish-white in color. Zosima pimpinelloides is adapted to cold, nutrient-poor environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
